Class FakeUserRepository

java.lang.Object
com.example.atlasevents.data.UserRepository
com.example.atlasevents.FakeUserRepository
public class FakeUserRepository extends UserRepository
This is a mock UserRepository class for intent tests

  • Method Details

    • addUser

      public void addUser(@NonNull User user, @NonNull UserRepository.OnUserUpdatedListener listener)
      Description copied from class: UserRepository
      Adds a new user to Firestore if the email does not already exist. The user's password is hashed before being stored.
      Overrides:
      addUser in class UserRepository
      Parameters:
      user - the User object to add.
      listener - callback invoked with operation status.

    • getUser

      public void getUser(String name, UserRepository.OnUserFetchedListener listener)
      Description copied from class: UserRepository
      Retrieves a general User object from Firestore by email.

      Typically used during sign-in to validate user credentials and determine user type.

      Overrides:
      getUser in class UserRepository
      Parameters:
      name - the email address of the user.
      listener - callback invoked when the user data is fetched.

    • getOrganizer

      Description copied from class: UserRepository

      Overrides:
      getOrganizer in class UserRepository
      Parameters:

    • setUser

      public void setUser(@NonNull String email, @NonNull User newUser, @NonNull UserRepository.OnUserUpdatedListener listener)
      Description copied from class: UserRepository
      Updates user information in Firestore.

      If the email is changed, this method checks whether the new email already exists. The old document is deleted only if the update is successful.

      Overrides:
      setUser in class UserRepository
      Parameters:
      email - the original email of the user.
      newUser - a User object containing updated details.
      listener - callback invoked with update status.

    • deleteUser

      Description copied from class: UserRepository
      Deletes a user from Firestore by their email.
      Overrides:
      deleteUser in class UserRepository
      Parameters:
      userEmail - The unique email of the user to delete.
